text: Otto Schubiger (6 January 1925 â€“ 28 January 2019) was a Swiss ice hockey player. He played for the ZSC Lions, GCK Lions and SC Rapperswil-Jona Lakers, winning the Swiss National League A championship in 1949 and 1961, both with ZSC. Internationally Schubiger played for the Swiss national team, winning a bronze medal at the 1948 Winter Olympics and bronze medals at the 1951 and 1953 World Championships. Schubiger died on 28 January 2019 in Baden at the age of 94. == References == Category:1925 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Swiss ice hockey players Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Switzerland Category:Ice hockey centres
title: Otto Schubiger
